qas.question: In what year did new discoveries change the course of research on Samoan origins?
In addition to linguistics and genetics, what field of study researches Samoan origins?
One theory posits that Samoans originated from what people during the Lapita expansion period?
What year marks the end of the period of the terminal eastward Lapita expansion?
What scientific disciplines are being used to study where the Austronesian people came from?
During what period did the Austronesians migrate from Southeast Asia and Melanesia?

plausible_answers.text: due to new scientific evidence and carbon dating findings

qas.question: Why are Austronesian origins now being reassessed?
From what period is new evidence being used to reassess Austronesian origins?
Whos origins are being studied in research about Melanesia?

context: The origins of <b8_0>the Samoans<b8_0/> are closely studied in modern research about Polynesia in various scientific disciplines such as <b4_0>genetics, linguistics and <a1_0>anthropology<b4_0/><a1_0/>. Scientific research is ongoing, although a number of different theories exist; including one proposing that the Samoans originated from <a2_0>Austronesian<a2_0/> predecessors during the terminal eastward Lapita expansion period from Southeast Asia and Melanesia <b5_0>between 2,500 and <a3_0>1,500 BCE<b5_0/><a3_0/>. The Samoan origins are currently being reassessed <b6_0>due to new scientific evidence and carbon dating findings<b6_0/> <b7_0>from <a0_0>2003<a0_0/> and onwards<b7_0/>.
